column24: Lifetime People who have liked your Page and engaged with your post

column42: Lifetime Post Audience Targeting Unique Consumptions by Type - link clicks

column9: Lifetime: The number of people who had your Page's post enter their screen. Posts include statuses, photos, links, videos and more. (Unique Users)
column10: Lifetime: The number of people who had your Page's post enter their screen through unpaid distribution. (Unique Users)
column11: Lifetime: The number of people who had your Page's post enter their screen through paid distribution such as an ad. (Unique Users)
column12: Lifetime: The number of times your Page's post entered a person's screen. Posts include statuses, photos, links, videos and more. (Total Count)
column13: Lifetime: The number of times your Page's posts entered a person's screen through unpaid distribution. (Total Count)
column14: Lifetime: The number of times your Page's post entered a person's screen through paid distribution such as an ad. (Total Count)
column15: Lifetime: The number of unique people who engaged in certain ways with your Page post, for example by commenting on, liking, sharing, or clicking upon particular elements of the post. (Unique Users)
column16: Lifetime: The number of people who matched the audience targeting that clicked anywhere in your post on News Feed. (Unique Users)
column17: Lifetime: The number of clicks anywhere in your post on News Feed from the user that matched the audience targeting on it. (Total Count)
column18: Lifetime: The number of people who have given negative feedback to your post. (Unique Users)
column19: Lifetime: The number of times people have given negative feedback to your post. (Total Count)
column20: Lifetime: The number of impressions of your Page post to people who have liked your Page. (Total Count)
column21: Lifetime: The number of people who saw your Page post because they've liked your Page (Unique Users)
column22: Lifetime: The number of paid impressions of your Page post to people who have liked your Page. (Total Count)
column23: Lifetime: The number of people who like your Page and who saw your Page post in an ad or sponsored story. (Unique Users)
column24: Lifetime: The number of people who have liked your Page and clicked anywhere in your posts. (Unique Users)
column25: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length without any paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column26: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length without any paid promotion. (Total Count)
column27: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length after paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column28: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length after paid promotion. (Total Count)
column29: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed for more than 3 seconds without any paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column30: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed for more than 3 seconds without any paid promotion. (Total Count)
column31: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed more than 3 seconds after paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column32: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed more than 3 seconds after paid promotion. (Total Count)
column33: Lifetime: Average time video viewed (Total Count)
column34: Lifetime: Length of a video post (Total Count)
column35: Lifetime: The number of unique people who created a story about your Page post by interacting with it. (Unique Users)
column38: Lifetime: The number of stories created about your Page post, by action type. (Total Count)
column41: Lifetime: The number of people who matched the audience targeting on the post that clicked anywhere in the post on News Feed, by type. (Unique Users)
column44: Lifetime: The number of clicks anywhere in the post on News Feed from users that matched the audience targeting on the post, by type. (Total Count)

column3:
It's a turning point for our Brujos, some for the better, but mostly for the worse. Something's got to give here and the New World Colonizers are just getting closer. The Brujos are going to have to fight back.

#BrujosTV #nationalstorytellingweek #opentvrewind

Be the first to hear about our premieres and events by signing up for the #opentvprogram weareopen.tv/program

This episode begins #BrujosTV Part 2 - The Hanged Man 

Pay attention to the lecture here, Professor Linda Alcott (Coya Paz) spits some very real knowledge about colonization:

"This genocide of bodies was also accompanied by epistemicide - the erasure or repression of alternative channels of knowledge and thought to understand the universe. Europeans burnt the Islamic libraries of Grenada, of the Aztec and Incans, of African civilizations. and since the native women of Europe were illiterate and passed their knowledge through oral tradition they burnt their bodies because their bodies were the books."

#opentvrewind #nationalstorytellingweek
Be the first to hear about our premieres and events by signing up for the #opentvprogram weareopen.tv/program

Here #BrujosTV explores what the effects of what the torture does to those that are tortured and those that do the torturing. We begin to see how widespread a toll this is taking on our Brujos, and how vast the destruction of the New World Colonizers is. 

#opentvrewind #nationalstorytellingweek

Be the first to hear about our premieres and events by signing up for the #opentvprogram weareopen.tv/program

In this episode of Brujos we meet Panfilo's Big Ex. You know, the ex you dated for years before you came out- that ex. 

#brujostv #opentvrewind #nationalstorytellingweek

Be the first to hear about our premieres and events by signing up for the #opentvprogram weareopen.tv/program

Brujos may be supernatural, but it teaches many real-life lessons. Among these lessons: always be skeptical of the police. 

#opentvrewind

Be the first to hear about our premieres and events by signing up for the #opentvprogram weareopen.tv/program

Happy #nationalstorytellingweek ! This week we are shining a light on Brujos, a supernatural genre-bending series about a queer-of-color web series that follows four gay Latino grad students that are also witches as they try and survive the school semester and a witch hunt led by the wealthy, white, male and heteronormative descendants of the first New World colonizers. 

It is written by one of Chicago's great storytellers, Ricardo Gamboa. The series is directed by Gamboa and Reshmi Hazra Rustebakke. 

#opentvrewind

What's the best way to tell people the wedding's off? Post cards? E-vites? 500 person group text? In episode 3, Geeta is left with a reminder the love of your life doesn't always have to be someone else. 

Great news! Eight new episodes of Geeta's Guide To Moving On is coming to #weareopentv this spring. Stay tuned and make sure you subscribe to our newsletter to stay updated. weareopen.tv/program 

#opentvrewind

LA CASTING CALL
Trans and poc actors strongly encouraged!

üö®MUSICIANS!üö® Get your music on an #opentvoriginal web series! 

#GeetasGuide #opentvrewind

In the second episode of Geeta's Guide To Moving On, our heroine finally starts opening up to the group and best friend Akua ( Danielle Pinnock-Wallace of Afternoon Snatch!) puts a positive spin on the depressingly-named "Divorce Dialogue" group. 

#GeetasGuide #opentvrewind

The show is about ‚Äúfinding the beauty and the messiness of life, discovering the opportunity for growth in our toughest and most disappointing experiences.‚Äù

Watch the first 3 episodes of Geeta's Guide to Moving On by Puja Mohindra here: https://vimeo.com/channels/geetasguide

#opentvrewind #GeetasGuide

It's a classic story, boy meets girl, girl falls for boy, girl gets dumped. 

Geeta Gidwani is an all-American girl hopelessly in love with her Indian-American Prince Charming until one day, he dumps her--after 10 years of dating. She's totally heartbroken, moves in with her Indian parents, and learns to move on with the help of her family and her best friend.

Geeta's Guide To Moving On is created by and stars Puja Mohindra. 

#GeetasGuide #opentvrewind
Thank you to InPathways: The Chicago Track for having us on Saturday for The Chicago Track : Web Series 101 with Open TV (beta)!

Our head of marketing is busy giving our website a facelift but they still make time to #SpreadTingle and educate the girls about the pleasure principle. Read the full story between Eli Micky and Vasilios Papapitsios on MEL Magazine.

It's so annoying when they start jogging after the break-up.
 
In the #IRL season finale, meet Charlie's (Liza Summers) ex, Nick who she was "practically married to" in real life. 

#opentvrewind

In Real Life is written and directed by Kate Royal and follows four millennial best friends as they stumble their way into adulthood amidst shifting identities, relationships, and questions of what it means to be there for your friends and community.

"I'm not judging, I'm fascinated as a scholar." 

How many times have you felt your boundaries pushed under the guise of "research"? What does the porn you watch say about you? 

Explore this interesting interplay between roommates Cleo (played by Theo Germaine) and their roommate 'Jer-bear' (played by Grant Cordes) in this episode of In Real Life. 

#opentvrewind

Is lesbian bed death fact or fiction? Keeping the spark alive is hard for Erin (played by Marybeth Kram) and her girlfriend (played by Celeste Riddle) in real life. 

In Real Life, written and directed by Kate Royal, is about four millennial best friends stumble their way into adulthood amidst shifting identities, relationships, and questions of what it means to be there for your friends and community.

#opentvrewind

Have you ever come out to a friend and been underwhelmed by their response? Do you have friends or family that don't believe in bisexuality? 

Oscar and his friends are struggling with both of these questions in this episode of #InRealLife written and directy by Kate Royal.

#opentvrewind

What does it look like to be a millennial and show up for your friends In Real Life? Check out this fresh take from Kate Royal starring Liza Summers, William Marquez, Theo Germaine (who also stars in Afternoon Snatch!), and Marybeth Kram. 

#opentvrewind

#Queertheair dating wisdom from pop culture expert, writer, and comedian Ashley Ray: 

If he has a girlfriend, he will only facebook message you
If he has a wife, he will only be in your twitter DMs
If he's single but not that into you, you might get some texts

Watch the full segment for more pearls of wisdom and Coriama's hilarious reaction faces filmed in front of a live studio audience! QTA is a docu-web series centered around interviews with black queer folx and covers everything from gender identity and relationships to body image and self-care, hosted by sex educator and artist Coriama.

Watch all of Segment I with life coach and tarot adviser Keon Dillon here: https://youtu.be/nuSvEdmR5Dg

Today on #opentvrewind we're introducing #QueerTheAir, a docu-series hosted by sex-educator and artist Coriama! 

The series is centered around interviews with Black queer folx, and covers everything from gender identity and relationships, to body image and self care. The pilot features Keon Dillon, a professional life coach and tarot adviser. 

Stay tuned for more: future guests include Lakeesha Harris of Black Witch Chronicles, pop culture expert and freelance writer Ashley Ray, and illustrator Tesh Silver!

Shout out to the crew: Director of Photography Miasarah Lai, editor and producer Rachel Jones, photographer Stephanie Jensen, impact producer Nicole Holmes, editor Yarnome Hamilton, public relations Walter Santiago, and set designer Javier Chapa.

"In collaboration with Angie Perez, ambivert has shifted into a dialogue about exhibiting physical freedom while managing chronic illness."- alegria on their inspiration for "ambivert." 
#opentvrewind 

Learn more about ester alegria, in this #opentvspotlight!

Get Open TV - beta news on our premieres and events first by signing up for our program: weareopen.tv/program

On #opentvrewind today we're slowing it down with "ambivert." a haunting meditation in manic visuals and ethereal sounds written, directed, and edited by ester alegria (Aquarius Aquarius). ambivert. explores transmuting energy from chronic pain, anxiety, and lethargy into thrusting sexual freedom, joy anger, empathy for self and communities of color. 

Sign up for the #weareopentv newsletter and be the first to know about our upcoming events and premieres! weareopen.tv/program

"Black Melodies" by Lauren Vernea, is the real-life Chicago manifestation of her narrative series Art Is Charisma: A New Web Series!

The show is a dramedy about Charisma James, a singer-songwriter who has an unhealthy, all-consuming relationship with her music. Watch the whole first season on YouTube!

#opentvrewind
Our head of Marketing and creator of #2QIK (Two Queens in a Kitchen) is cooking up a new original web series and wants to werq with YOU! Are you that somebody?

Filmmaker Lauren Vernea‚Äã introduced us to Chicago musician Sam Trump‚Äã with her docu-series Black Melodies. Want more? Check out his upcoming performances! 

Tonight: After Work at The Robey: Sam Trump
Tomorrow: Sam Trump at Some Like It Black (Winter Blue)

#opentvrewind

Stay up to date and sign up for the Open TV - beta‚Äã program: weareopen.tv/program
We're so excited for this show! #SEEDSTV #OTVOriginals

Today for #opentvrewind, dig into Black Melodies, a musical documentary series that explores the artistic journeys of Chicago‚Äôs young, black, and gifted musicians by Lauren Vernea!

The pilot episode is dedicated to exceptional vocalist and multi-instrumentalist Sam Trump talking about the challenges of self-management, his artistic process and more. 

Watch the full episode here: https://vimeo.com/238458996

Get all of our news first: weareopen.tv/program
If you've ever wondered how to direct, produce, or get people to watch your web series, then this workshop is for you! Don't forget to register and use the code TRACK1104 for a 50% discount!

#StarvingArtists co-creator Aasia LaShay Bullock's album "Unemployed", is a certified bop that is as hilarious as it is relatable. 

Watch all of the award-winning Starving Artists here: https://vimeo.com/channels/starvingartists

Stay up to date and sign up for our newsletter: weareopen.tv/program

Get to know Starving Artists co-creator, comedian, actor, and essence of #blackboyjoy, Dewayne Perkins, in this interview with Kellye Howard of Kellye Talks the Podcast. 

#opentvrewind

Meet your new favorite sketch show, New York Television Festival‚Äã award-winner, #StarvingArtists. You're welcome. 

Starving Artists comes to you from the blacknificent comedy duo Aasia LaShay Bullock‚Äã and Dewayne Perkins‚Äã in a show about being young, gifted, and black in a world that praises straight, white, and wack.

Check out the first episode now -- we're loving the Living Single‚Äã resurgence, shout out to the homies Hulu‚Äã, Cardi B‚Äã and Bruno Mars.

Did you catch Open TV - beta founder and head of development, Aymar Jean Christian's #BlerdDating chat with #chilltowntv last night? If not, head to twitter and search #blerddating to get the T on the Open TV book, the driving force behind us, where Open TV is heading, and more. 

We'll be RTing threads from the convo as well: twitter.com/weareopentv

Happy Martin Luther King Day, fam. On this day we also honor the incredible work of Coretta Scott King.

This week for #opentvrewind, we will be uplifting some of our incredible black artists. 

Today, enjoy "Triggers", a short film by writer, poet, scholar, abolitionist, and filmmaker Kai M Green. Triggers is a poetic journey through the weight of witness, the stories of Marissa Alexander and other instances of intimate partner violence that Green witnessed as an adult and a child are central.

Starring: Julian Kevon Glover, Anna Martine Whitehead, and Mlondi Zondi

"Two Queens in a Kitchen is like Bell Hooks meets Martha Stewart: A rotating stable of hosts prepare a meal while they discuss topics relevant to the LGBTQ community, including intersectional feminism, race, and the role of self-care in activism." - Into

Read on for an overview of more #opentvoriginals including the award-winning, Brown Girls, and shows you can look forward to this season: Quare Life Web Series and #TheTTV. 

#opentvrewind #2QIK

We‚Äôre excited to announce a spin-off of Eli Micky‚Äôs Two Queens in a Kitchen #2QIK: Southern Style, starring Dr. E. Patrick Johnson! The series will focus on culinary arts from the South and South Side. #OpenTVCommunity

Today for #opentvrewind our queens are Brown Girls star, Rashaad Hall, and Kissing Walls star, Nathaniel Tenenbaum! 

They're whipping up overnight oats and strawberry bruschetta while talking about their relationship to their characters searching for love and diversity in the arts!

As we gear up for our spring season don't miss a beat, sign up for the Open TV - beta newsletter now: http://weareopen.tv/program
Want to know how Open TV - beta works? Mark your calendars and don't forget to RSVP: bit.ly/ChiTrackOpenTVBeta

Today on #opentvrewind watch these two Chicago natives chop it up about the public schools of Chicago's past, their first times falling in love with the art world and queer economies. 

Meet filmmaker and teaching artist Oli Rodriguez and working artist, member of Honey Pot Performance, and devoted Prince #purplefamily Felicia Holman in Two Queens in a Kitchen! 

Pro tip: You can catch Felicia in #SerialDreamer, Open TV's newest pilot directed by Aymar Jean Christian, debuting this season! Stay up to date by signing up for our newsletter: http://www.weareopen.tv/program

What better time to talk about femmergy and building femme futures than the week of #Oprah2020? 

Dive into Two Queens in a Kitchen season 2 with cultural producer and Slo 'Mo founder Kristen Kaza and artist, activator, aesthetic consultant, and Sex KiKi founder, Coriama!

Pro tip: Coriama has since come out with an Open TV - beta show of her very own! Check out her show, Queer the Air, coming up on #opentvrewind later this month! Link to intro video in comments.

"The second season [of Two Queens in a Kitchen] explores topics like the power of intersectional feminism, how to seek moments of pleasure in hostile climates, and the inter-workings of pursuing joy as a marginalized person‚Äïover banana oatmeal chocolate chip cookies, tossed chicken salad, and strawberry bruschetta." - Out Magazine 

Click through to check out the first episode of #2QIK Season 2! 

Check out the first season here: https://vimeo.com/179704860

#opentvrewind

#OpenTVrewind is BACK reintroducing you to your faves to get you through these icy days. 

First up, we're casting springtime spells with Two Queens in a Kitchen. In episode one, Open TV - beta Founder, Head of Development, and resident dad, Aymar Jean Christian is chatting with Head of Marketing and cunty big sister, Eli Micky to let you in on the inner workings of Open TV - beta talking artist incubation and claiming space. Stay in, get cozy, and binge watch all four episodes with us. 

#2QIK

Want to more about how to develop and produce your own TV projects? Join Founder Aymar Jean Christian, head of production Stephanie Jeter, and directors Zak Payne, Ricardo Gamboa and Reshmi Hazra Rustebakke at Free Spirit Media's "Web Series 101" -- a day of workshops and panels!

Thank you Chicago Reader for giving Daniel Kyri Madison & Bea Cordelia‚Äôs #TheTTV a shout-out! We are debuting the teaser trailer today! Link in article.

‚ÄúFrom the second the pair's onscreen there's a palpable yet complicated chemistry between them that promises a compelling story in the episodes to come.‚Äù
Attention aspiring film workers!

Mark your calendars for the Chicago premiere of the #OpenTVBook at the Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago, where our founder Dr. Aymar Jean Christian will read from his work and dialogue with noted film historian Dr. Jacqueline Stewart! 

https://www.facebook.com/events/157614374864144??ti=ia
